com.azure.storage.file

Class ShareClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.azure.storage.file.ShareClient

  • public class ShareClient
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides a client that contains all the operations for interacting with a share in Azure Storage Share. Operations allowed by the client are creating and deleting the share, creating snapshots for the share, creating and deleting directories in the share and retrieving and updating properties metadata and access policies of the share.

    Instantiating a Synchronous Share Client

    Snippet 'com.azure.storage.file.shareClient.instantiation' not found.

    View this for additional ways to construct the client.

    See Also:
    ShareClientBuilder, ShareAsyncClient, SharedKeyCredential, SASTokenCredential

      Creates the directory in the share with the given name and associates the passed metadata to it.

      • getShareUrl

        public java.net.URL getShareUrl()
        Get the url of the storage share client.
        Returns:
        the url of the Storage Share.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - If the share is using a malformed URL.

      • getRootDirectoryClient

        public DirectoryClient getRootDirectoryClient()
        Constructs a DirectoryClient that interacts with the root directory in the share.

        If the directory doesn't exist in the share create in the client will need to be called before interaction with the directory can happen.

        Returns:
        a DirectoryClient that interacts with the root directory in the share

      • getDirectoryClient

        public DirectoryClient getDirectoryClient(java.lang.String directoryName)
        Constructs a DirectoryClient that interacts with the specified directory.

        If the directory doesn't exist in the share create in the client will need to be called before interaction with the directory can happen.

        Parameters:
        directoryName - Name of the directory
        Returns:
        a DirectoryClient that interacts with the directory in the share

        Code Samples

        Snippet 'com.azure.storage.file.shareClient.create' not found.

      • create

        public Response<ShareInfo> create(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> metadata,
                                  java.lang.Integer quotaInGB)
        Creates the share in the storage account with the specified metadata and quota.

        Code Samples

        Create the share with metadata "share:metadata"

        Snippet 'com.azure.storage.file.shareClient.create#map-integer.metadata' not found.

        Create the share with a quota of 10 GB

        Snippet 'com.azure.storage.file.shareClient.create#map-integer.quota' not found.
        Parameters:
        metadata - Optional metadata to associate with the share
        quotaInGB - Optional maximum size the share is allowed to grow to in GB. This must be greater than 0 and less than or equal to 5120. The default value is 5120.
        Returns:
        A response containing information about the share and the status its creation.
        Throws:
        StorageErrorException - If the share already exists with different metadata or quotaInGB is outside the allowed range.

      • createSnapshot

        public Response<ShareSnapshotInfo> createSnapshot()
        Creates a snapshot of the share with the same metadata associated to the share at the time of creation.

        Code Samples

        Create a snapshot

        Snippet 'com.azure.storage.file.shareClient.createSnapshot' not found.
        Returns:
        A response containing information about the snapshot of share.
        Throws:
        StorageErrorException - If the share doesn't exist, there are 200 snapshots of the share, or a snapshot is in progress for the share

      • createSnapshot

        public Response<ShareSnapshotInfo> createSnapshot(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> metadata)
        Creates a snapshot of the share with the metadata that was passed associated to the snapshot.

        Code Samples

        Create a snapshot with metadata "snapshot:metadata"

        Snippet 'com.azure.storage.file.shareClient.createSnapshot#map' not found.
        Parameters:
        metadata - Optional metadata to associate with the snapshot. If null the metadata of the share will be copied to the snapshot.
        Returns:
        A response containing information about the snapshot of share.
        Throws:
        StorageErrorException - If the share doesn't exist, there are 200 snapshots of the share, or a snapshot is in progress for the share

        Snippet 'com.azure.storage.file.shareClient.setQuota' not found.

        information about the share
        Throws:

      • setMetadata

        public Response<ShareInfo> setMetadata(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> metadata)
        Sets the user-defined metadata to associate to the share.

        If null is passed for the metadata it will clear the metadata associated to the share.

        Code Samples

        Set the metadata to "share:updatedMetadata"

        Snippet 'com.azure.storage.file.shareClient.setMetadata#map' not found.

        Clear the metadata of the share

        Snippet 'com.azure.storage.file.shareClient.clearMetadata#map' not found.
        Parameters:
        metadata - Metadata to set on the share, if null is passed the metadata for the share is cleared
        Returns:
        information about the share
        Throws:
        StorageErrorException - If the share doesn't exist or the metadata contains invalid keys

      • setAccessPolicy

        public Response<ShareInfo> setAccessPolicy(java.util.List<SignedIdentifier> permissions)
        Sets stored access policies for the share.

        Code Samples

        Set a read only stored access policy

        Snippet 'com.azure.storage.file.shareClient.setAccessPolicy' not found.
        Parameters:
        permissions - Access policies to set on the queue
        Returns:
        A response that only contains headers and response status code
        Throws:
        StorageErrorException - If the share doesn't exist, a stored access policy doesn't have all fields filled out, or the share will have more than five policies.

      • createDirectory

        public Response<DirectoryClient> createDirectory(java.lang.String directoryName)
        Creates the directory in the share with the given name.

        Code Samples

        Create the directory "documents"

        Snippet 'com.azure.storage.file.shareClient.createDirectory#string' not found.
        Parameters:
        directoryName - Name of the directory
        Returns:
        A response containing a DirectoryClient to interact with the created directory and the status of its creation.
        Throws:
        StorageErrorException - If the share doesn't exist, the directory already exists or is in the process of being deleted, or the parent directory for the new directory doesn't exist

      • createDirectory

        public Response<DirectoryClient> createDirectory(java.lang.String directoryName,
                                                 java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> metadata)
        Creates the directory in the share with the given name and associates the passed metadata to it.

        Code Samples

        Create the directory "documents" with metadata "directory:metadata"

        Snippet 'com.azure.storage.file.shareClient.createDirectory#string-map' not found.
        Parameters:
        directoryName - Name of the directory
        metadata - Optional metadata to associate with the directory
        Returns:
        A response containing a DirectoryAsyncClient to interact with the created directory and the status of its creation.
        Throws:
        StorageErrorException - If the share doesn't exist, the directory already exists or is in the process of being deleted, the parent directory for the new directory doesn't exist, or the metadata is using an illegal key name
